content: airplane crochet one plane is a wwii bomber chosen for its orange and green combo the other is a commercial airliner note total number of sts in each round is shown in brackets key single_crochet-increase = single_crochet increase single_crochet-decrease = single_crochet decrease tbl = through back loop body starting with nose-cone colour 5 single_crochet into a ring 5 1 single_crochet-increase in each st 10 2 single_crochet all around 10 3 single_crochet-increase in every 2nd st 15 4 single_crochet all around 15 5 single_crochet-increase in every 3rd st 20 6 single_crochet all around 20 7 single_crochet-increase in every 4th sts 25 swtich to airplane-body colour 8-16 single_crochet all around 25 17 single_crochet-decrease every 4th st 20 18 single_crochet all around 20 stuff the body 19 single_crochet-decrease every 3rd st 15 20 single_crochet all around 15 21 single_crochet tbl all around 15 22 single_crochet-decrease every 2nd st 10 23 single_crochet-decrease every st 5 bind off and run the tail through the remaining stitches pull tight and hide the tail in the body of the plane the body should be bullet-shaped with a round flat butt cockpit starting with airplane-body colour 5 single_crochet into a ring 5 1 single_crochet-increase in each st 10 2 single_crochet-increase in every 2nd st 15 3 single_crochet-increase in every 3rd st 20 4-5 single_crochet all around 20 6-7 single_crochet 10 sts switch to window colour and single_crochet 10 sts switch back to airplane-body colour 20 8 single_crochet all around with airplane-body colour 20 bind off tail chain 8 sts single_crochet a square and bind off fold square along the bias single_crochet the edges shut and sew to the end of the airplane wings - make 2 chain 12 sts single_crochet a square and bind off fold square along the bias single_crochet the edges shut and sew to the sides of the airplane
